sen.j: ところがこの曲は春の物狂いの形をとりながら、一粒種である梅若丸を人買いにさらわれ、京都から武蔵国の隅田川まで流浪し、愛児の死を知った母親の悲嘆を描く。
sen.e: However, although the piece takes a form of haru no monogurui, it describes grief of a mother, whose only child, Umewakamaru, was kidnapped and who she traveled from Kyoto to Sumida-gawa River in Musashi Province and found out the death of her beloved son.
